Name: Manhattan (Sweet with Bitter Chocolate)
Ingredients: 5 ml De Kuyper Brown Crème de Cacao
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of square of 80% cacao chocolate.
Garnish with chocolate balanced on rim.
Review: Those with a sweet tooth should not be misled by the word "sweet" in the name of this drink, which refers to the use of sweet vermouth in what is a dry but not bone-dry spirituous cocktail. Bourbon provides the backbone, maraschino a faint cherry fruitiness, while the all-important chocolate bitters add, well, bitter chocolate notes. Oh, and there's a dash of dark chocolate liqueur for decadence sake.
History: Created by yours truly in April 2017 at the Cabinet Room in London, England. See: Manhattan cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Manhattan (Sweet with Bitter Chocolate) contains 211 calories
